TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed BootMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the boot mode in which the system was started.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration defines identifiers that represent the standard operating system startup modes.
This enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SystemInformation.BootMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SystemInformation> class.
The Normal boot mode is the standard system startup mode. The FailSafe boot mode is also called safe mode. The FailSafeWithNetwork boot mode is also called safe mode with networking.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.BootMode FailSafe = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The computer was started in safe mode without network support. This mode uses a limited drivers and settings profile.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.BootMode FailSafeWithNetwork = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The computer was started in safe mode with network support. This mode uses a limited drivers and settings profile, and loads the services needed to start networking.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.BootMode Normal = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The computer was started in the standard boot mode. This mode uses the normal drivers and settings for the system.
